trans-unit.source: Implements a custom persistence format for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoice"></xref> class.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
ASP.NET server controls can implement customized persistence formats by using their own control builder.
This is done by creating a control builder class and adding a control builder attribute to the class.
Control builder objects are used when the page is parsed and compiled.
For more information, see [Implementing Custom Persistence](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/ac8e85a9-422e-49b8-98c0-5ade5853ea7c).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoiceControlBuilder"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Adds the specified literal content to a control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The literal content to add to a control.
Adds builders to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object for any child controls that belong to the container control.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> object.
Obtains the type for the control's child controls.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
A string that represents the name of the tag.
An <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> object.
None.
Occurs when the server control is initialized, which is the first step in its life cycle.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This method is called by the ASP.NET page framework during parsing and is not intended to be called directly in your code.
The template parser object responsible for parsing the control.
The control builder object responsible for building the parent control.
If the <xref href="System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder"></xref> is not a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificControlBuilder"></xref> object, an exception is thrown.
The type that is assigned to the control that the builder will create.
The name of the tag to be built.
This enables the builder to support multiple tag types.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.ControlBuilder.ID*> attribute that is assigned to the control.
The <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> object that holds the specified tag attributes.
parentBuilder is not a object.
